contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration. The only valuable thing she had was a jar of oil. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing in the house, except a pot of oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration that means the men saw these items scattered along the road as they traveled. Alternate translation: "there were clothes and equipment all along the road" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the road was full of clothes and equipment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization to show that a large group of people tore down the temple of Baal. Alternate translation: a large number of the people of the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people of the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. It is possible that some did not rejoice. Alternate translation: "many people in the land rejoiced" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people of the land rejoiced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Some people may not have wanted him to be king. Alternate translation: "The people of Judah took the 16 year-old Azariah and made him king after his father, Amaziah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah

contextId.occurrenceNote: God wanted his people to offer sacrifices to him in Jerusalem. The word "every" here is an exaggeration to show how determined King Ahaz was to disobey God by offering sacrifices in many other places instead. Alternate translation: "under many green trees" or "under many green trees around the country" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
These are exaggerations to show that worship of false gods was widespread. Alternate translation: "on high hills and under green trees everywhere" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: on every high hill and under every green tree

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a boast that Sennacherib has so many soldiers that their feet dry up the water when they cross a river. This is an exaggeration to emphasize the great number of soldiers he has. Alternate translation: "And by marching through the streams of Egypt, we dried them all up!" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: I dried up all the rivers of Egypt under the soles of my feet.

contextId.occurrenceNote: Hezekiah repeats the same idea in two ways to emphasize his point. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-parallelism]])
contextId.glQuote: They have seen everything in my house. There is nothing among my valuable things that I have not shown them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This hyperbole emphasizes the great number of people Manasseh had killed throughout Jerusalem. The abstract noun "death" can be stated as "dead people." Alternate translation: "there were very many dead people throughout Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another with death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "some of the people in Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "many other people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "all" is a generalization. It means he did the same sinful things as his father. Alternate translation: "he committed the same kinds of sins his father had committed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: he did all that his father had done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "many people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
